DOC.brief_summary: - Background Context : study identify analyse effect real time feedback ( use inertial sensor ) physiotherapy student learn art posterior-anterior thoracic manipulation ( PATM ) . - Purpose : study effect cause real-time feedback learn process PATM , compare two undergraduate physiotherapy student group . Hypothesis : significant difference exist execution parameter manipulation among student receive real-time feedback versus . - Study Design/Setting : longitudinal , pre-post intervention . - Patient Sample : Sixty-one undergraduate physiotherapy student divide randomly two group , G1 ( n = 31 ) ( group without feedback real time ) G2 ( n = 30 ) ( group real-time feedback ) . - Outcome Measures : time , displacement velocity improvement ( group ) reach maximum peak , reach minimum peak maximum peak , total manipulation time . - Methods : two group physiotherapy student learn PATM , one use traditional method use real-time feedback ( inertial sensor ) . Measures obtain pre- post-intervention . Intragroup pre- post-intervention intergroup post-intervention score calculate . An analysis measure ' stability develop ICC ( 1,2 ) . - Results : value ICC range 0.881 0.997 . Statistically significant difference find variable analyse ( intra- inter-group ) favour G2 . - Conclusions : learn process posterior-anterior thoracic manipulation facilitate student receives real-time feedback .
DOC.criteria: Participants train manual therapy technique , especially involve high velocity , low amplitude execution . Refusal participate study
